author: daxian-dbw
body:
Part of the work for #3961

`dotnet-runtime-2.0.0` Linux packages for Debian distributions depend on different lib packages on different distros, for example, `libicu52` on `ubuntu.14.04`, `libicu55` on `ubuntu.16.04`, `libicu57` on `ubuntu.17.04`, `libicu52` on `debian 8`, and `libicu57` on `debian 9`. A similar issue also happens to `libssl` -- `libssl1.0.2` on `debian 9` and `libssl1.0.0` on the rest debian distros.

In order to use a single DEB package for all distros, we need to depend on `-dev` packages, like `libicu-dev` and `libssl-dev`. However, dev packages are not meant for production software, and dotnet core has separate DEB package for each Debian distro, so I think we should do that too.

So for Debian distros, we have a separate package for each distro. For Red Hat family, we have a single RPM package, just like the `dotnet-runtime-2.0.0` package.

Even though we have separate packages for Debian distros, we now can create them all from one single build. Given that AppImage current needs to be created on `ubuntu.14.04`, we can generate all pacakges from `ubuntu.14.04`.
For RPM package, we should generate it from `CentOS7`.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: @TravisEz13 @adityapatwardhan The changes in `Start-PSPackage` looks huge, but actually is not that much. It shows a big chunk of changes because the existing script needs to be moved to `End { ... }` block due to the introduction of the dynamic parameter `-Distribution`. This dynamic parameter is enabled only if `-Type deb` is specified, so that we can indicate which Debian distro the package is targeting.

I have tested all packages on all supported distros except for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. They are:
`Ubuntu.14.04`, `Ubuntu.16.04`, `Ubuntu.17.04`, `CentOS7`, `openSUSE 42,2`, `Fedora 25`, `Fedora 26`.

The AppImage is tested too.
